result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Harold Scott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in Court, in custody.  Attorney John c Glover appeared by video for Aaron Harold Scott.  Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE SWANSON, BRANCH 11.**
Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing with Defendant's other case, 22CF764. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Glover was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office and has NOT received discovery material. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 11. 
Status hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 11:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defendant will be produced.
received and filed.

JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE SWANSON, BRANCH 11.
Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in Court, in custody.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing with Defendant's other Case, 22CF764. Discussion placed on the record. Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for Defendant. Case adjourned for Order to Show Cause hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. If counsel has not been appointed by the next date, Court will appoint counsel at county expense. Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 04:00 pm. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in court. Defendant in custody. Attorney Jacob Corr appeared on behalf of Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE SWANSON, BRANCH 11.**
Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing with Defendant's other case 22CF764.  Discussion placed on the record. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. If no counsel is appointed by next hearing, Court will set an Order to Show Cause hearing. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 8:30 am. Hearing will be held in room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE SWANSON, BRANCH 11.**
JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.
Case in Court for Motion hearing with Defendant's other case 22CF764. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the court of Defendant's requst for new counsel. Statements made by Defendant. State did not object. For reasons seated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense's Motion to Withdraw. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's office. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing.  Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 1:30 pm. Hearing will be held in room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defense contacted the Court and State via email regarding Defendant's request for new counsel. 
Motion to Withdraw hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:15 am. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
Information provided to MCSO.
Judge Feiss, Branch 46 agreed to hear this case on August 5, 2022.

Defense previously filed a Request for Substitution of Judge.  
Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.

JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38.
Attorney Ashley Fard in Court, Defendant Aaron Harold Scott not in Court, in custody.  Eric Bashirian on behalf of Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheudling Conference. Defendant also has Case 22CF764 pending in Branch 46 and scheduled today. Due to COVID-19 protocol, Defendant was not able to be produced for today's hearing. Dsicussion placed on the record. Defense previously requested to address bail and agreed for bail to be heard by Branch 46. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard. For reasons stated o nthe record, Court DENIED Defense Motion to Modify Bail. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 11.  Status hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Williams Rakestraw on behalf of Ashley Fard in court, defendant Aaron Harold Scott not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set Scheduling Conference. Defendant has pending case in Branch 46. Court authorizes transfer of this case for global resolution. Case adjourned, Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 09:45 am.
filed.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD. Defense in trial on another matter and request case set over. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Young.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.

JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38.
Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in Court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr on behalf of Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing with Defendant's other Case, 22CF764(Branch 46). Defendant and Defense appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. State appeared via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Fard was really appointed by the Public Defender's Office, pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am in Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
received and filed.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for a State V. Lee hearing. Matter to be heard in Br. 46 Judge Feiss  for Br. 38 Judge Wagner to track with 22CF764.  Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aaron Harold Scott appeared by video means.
SPD needs more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Last time for adjourment in Preliminary Hearing court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
